sentences.english: Through the trial, was initially arrested the two men and Lim Yang.
sentences.chinese: 通過審訊，最初被抓獲的兩男子爲任某和楊某。

sentences.english: The 3-day process will set the agenda for the trial, which is scheduled in February.
sentences.chinese: 準備程序庭將爲2月的審訊設定程序。

sentences.english: We court risk more avidly as teens than at any other time.
sentences.chinese: 法庭審訊青少年的冒險行爲比其他任何時候都多。

sentences.english: Hence, it is natural that some people are being investigated or questioned.
sentences.chinese: 既然是在調查，就需要對一些人進行調查和審訊。

sentences.english: Cao Zheng waiting to militia, stop von instructor Zhang Bingfei trial.
sentences.chinese: 曹政等人前往民兵連，阻止馮指導員審訊張秉飛。

sentences.english: Mr. Trainum has become an advocate of videotaping entire interrogations.
sentences.chinese: 特娜姆先生支持對審訊進行全程錄像。

sentences.english: DeSalvo gets a call from his superiors giving Jack permission to interrogate the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 迪沙佛接到上級的電話，批准了傑克審訊維克托。

sentences.english: Before the trial Liz had been pictured as a frail woman dominated by her husband.
sentences.chinese: 審訊之前，利茲被描繪成受丈夫操縱的孱弱女子。
他甚至可能接受軍事法庭審訊。

sentences.english: The dogs get hosed down after a race or trial.
sentences.chinese: 狗種族或審訊後得到大清洗了。

sentences.english: Perhaps the endless interrogation he is now undergoing will tell.
sentences.chinese: 他正在接受的沒完沒了的審訊或許會告訴我們。
1633年，伽利略受到宗教法庭審訊。

sentences.english: On the Pegasus, who was known as "the Cylon-interrogator"?
sentences.chinese: 在珀伽索斯號上，誰被認爲是“賽昂審訊者”？

sentences.english: Corporal punishment must be abolished in trying criminals.
sentences.chinese: 審訊犯人時必須廢止肉刑。

sentences.english: The International Criminal Court holds its first trial in May.
sentences.chinese: 國際刑事法庭將在五月進行第一次審訊。

sentences.english: By inquest , he fessed that he was the chief instigator of this crime group.
sentences.chinese: 經過審訊，他供認了他是這個犯罪團伙的主謀。

definition: on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
preliminary hearing/interrogation (of a suspect)/preliminary examination (of a project etc)
